instance.context:
If a jazz musician states that an
ensemble performance is " really swinging , " this suggests that the performers are playing with a special degree of rhythmic coherence and " feel . " Although referring to a " sense of swing " is often done in the context of ensemble performances ( e.g. a jazz combo or band ) , even an unaccompanied soloist can be said to be performing with " swing . "

a hook delivered with an exaggerated
swing ;

a
swing downward of a golf_club ;

pendulum with a long wire ; can swing in any direction ; the change in the
swing plane demonstrates the earth's rotation ;

United_States clarinetist who in 1934 formed a big_band ( including black as_well as white musicians ) and introduced a kind of jazz known_as
swing ;

the party went with a
swing ;

it took time to get into the
swing of things ;

with an outward or horizontal
swing of the arm ;

hit in the direction that the player is facing when carrying through the
swing ;
